description: Keep up on Earthquakes happening around the world.  Using Quaker for WebOS you can have US Geological Survey (USGS) updates right at your fingertips.  Drawing from the real-time database at the USGS, Quaker downloads the latest earthquake data and displays it on your WebOS phone quickly and in a way you can use.  Using Location Services, Quaker lets you know precisely how far an Earthquake was from where you are at the moment.  Set up your own filter so you see only the earthquakes that you’re interested in.  Filter on distance from your current location, strength, and time.  Tap on the earthquake of interest, and a details page shows the exact location and time, along with a link to more information from the USGS Website. With a tap, you can open Google Maps right to the spot where the earthquake happened. With just a few quick taps you can quickly send a pre formatted SMS or E-mail with basic quake information and a link to the USGS page to loved ones and friends to alert them, or let them know you’re just fine.    Future updates will allow you to post a Twitter and/or Facebook status about the Quake, background updates with notifications based on your filter, and more.  Get on board with Quaker now and see what’s shakin'  ** Update v1.0.2 - Fixes a problem with incorrect dates being displayed.
